title: Free-body diagrams - platform held by pulleys

content.question: A large box of mass <math alttext="uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> is at rest on a platform of mass <math alttext="lowercase m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, where <math alttext="uppercase M is greater than lowercase m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi><mo>></mo><mi>m</mi></math>. These objects are suspended by two strings and each string passes over a separate pulley attached to the ceiling, as shown. Which of the following correctly states the number of upward forces acting on the box-platform system and provides the correct justification?

choices.label: Two upward forces are exerted on the system because there are two strings which exert upward forces on the system.
Two upward forces are exerted on the system because there are two pulleys which exert upward forces on the system.
Four upward forces are exerted on the system because there are two strings and two pulleys which exert upward forces on the system.
Four upward forces are exerted on the system because there are four tensions which exert upward forces on the system.

content.answer: Four upward forces are exerted on the system because there are four tensions which exert upward forces on the system.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
